meanings.definition: To move easily without using power or effort.
meanings.sent1: The bicycle was coasting down the hill effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The car was coasting along the highway smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder was coasting so smoothly that it looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was coasting through life without any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The boat was coasting on the calm waters, gliding peacefully.

meanings.definition: To progress without making much effort.
meanings.sent1: He was coasting through the easy exam without any stress.
meanings.sent2: The team was coasting to victory with their strong lead.
meanings.sent3: The student was coasting through the assignment, not realizing the mistakes made.
meanings.sent4: The company was coasting towards success with their innovative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The bird was coasting effortlessly through the sky, enjoying the freedom.

meanings.definition: To sail along without using power.
meanings.sent1: The sailboat was coasting gracefully on the calm sea.
meanings.sent2: The yacht was coasting smoothly with the wind in its sails.
meanings.sent3: The pirate ship was coasting towards the treasure island, ready for adventure.
meanings.sent4: The canoe was coasting silently through the peaceful lake.
meanings.sent5: The fishing boat was coasting slowly, waiting for the perfect catch.

meanings.sent1: After the hard work, she was coasting through the final presentation.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was coasting towards the finish line, confident in their lead.
meanings.sent3: The car was coasting smoothly on the empty road, enjoying the ride.
meanings.sent4: The project was coasting towards completion, with everything falling into place.
meanings.sent5: The skier was coasting down the slope, feeling the thrill of the speed.
